text: Mohamed Atta (; September 1, 1968 â€“ September 11, 2001) was an Egyptian associate of al-QaedaRichard Bernstein: On Path to the U.S. Skies, Plot Leader Met bin Laden. The New York Times, 2002-09-10Yosri Fouda: Chilling message of the 9/11 plots. The Sunday Times, 2006-10-1 and one of the leaders of the nineteen hijackers who carried out the September 11 attacks. He personally participated in the hijacking of American Airlines Flight 11, the first plane to crash into the World Trade Center during the September 11, 2001 attacks. == References == Category:1968 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Al-Qaeda people Category:Egyptian Muslims Category:September 11 attacks Category:Kafr El Sheikh Governorate
title: Mohamed Atta
